meanings.sent1: I need to reprograming my alarm clock to wake me up earlier.
meanings.sent2: The technician is reprograming the security system for better protection.
meanings.sent3: After accidentally setting the wrong time, I had to reprograming my watch.
meanings.sent4: Just like a musician fine-tuning their instrument, reprograming a robot requires precision.
meanings.sent5: The scientist spent hours reprograming the robot to perform a new task flawlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of changing or updating a program or system
meanings.sent1: The reprograming of the software fixed all the bugs.
meanings.sent2: Our team is responsible for the reprograming of the company's website.
meanings.sent3: The reprograming of the vending machine made it dispense free snacks.
meanings.sent4: The constant reprograming of the game kept players engaged with new features.
meanings.sent5: The reprograming of the traffic lights reduced congestion in the city.

meanings.definition: The process of altering the instructions in a computer program
meanings.sent1: The reprograming of the code improved the software's performance.
meanings.sent2: Learning about reprograming is essential for computer science students.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected reprograming of the game led to hilarious glitches.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, reprograming is like rewriting a story with a new ending.
meanings.sent5: The reprograming of the robot's commands made it respond faster to commands.
